name: Linter Cop Rules - Code Style
description: Rules that are adjusted to our needs - and enforced now.

rules.justification: Do not use an Object ID for properties or variable declarations.
DrillDownPageId and LookupPageId must be filled in table when table is used in list page.
The casing of variable/method usage must align with the definition.
Every object needs to specify a value for the Access property. ~ From runtime 4.0. Script comments this for unsupported versions.
Any table with a single field in the PK of type code or text, should have set NotBlank on the PK field.
Procedure or Trigger declaration should not end with semicolon.
Clear(All) does not affect or change values for global variables in single instance codeunits.
Empty Captions should be Locked. ~ Set to Error to avoid empty strings in translation files.
Tables coupled with TransferFields must have matching fields.
Zero (0) Enum value should be reserved for Empty Value.

Use Error with a ErrorInfo or Label variable to improve telemetry details. ~ Set to None to accommodate the use of Error with a MOB Message e.g. Error(MobWmsLanguage.GetMessage('WHSE_TRKG_NEEDED'), _ItemNo);
The suffix Tok is meant to be used when the value of a locked label matches the name.
Duplicate ToolTip between page and table field.
The field with table relation should have at least the same length as the referenced field.
Methods should always be called with parenthesis.
Use the new PageStyle datatype instead string literals. ~ Set to None as this is shown for code that is not page style related. And it is not that important to change.
Translatable texts should be translated. ~ Set to None because of new translation flow.
